tweets.text: More work to reduce pollution that washes into the #Tyne rivers from old metal mines. These log barriers stabilise the riverbank and stop toxic chemicals from  spoil heaps flowing from #Nenthead in the #Pennines all the way downstream to #Tynemouth. @EnvAgencyYNE @CoalAuthority https://t.co/bv3eyKkIhq

Help your local community by becoming a #Flood Warden - volunteers trained to help & prepare communities at risk of flooding. Find out more https://t.co/eN83CAkUw0 @EnvAgencySE @EdenbridgeTC @EynsfordParish @ShorehamKent #sundridge https://t.co/tgeczPNOYt

urls.title: Flood wardens | Kent Prepared
urls.description: Flood wardens are volunteers trained to help and prepare people in local communities that are at risk of flooding. They play an important role in the preparing a community flood plan and putting it in to practice. They also provide a vital link between a local community and those responsible for responding to a flood. You will be the eyes and ears of the community and will help develop your local flood plan. You can choose to meet with other flood wardens in your community as often as you like, typically

tweets.text: @YorkshireWater There‚Äôs something blocking the fish pass on The Little Don river as it enters Langsett Reservoir. @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/Wm5xpRplmV

As a little contrast everyday water companies leak 2,954,000,000 litres of water from their underinvested, under repaired, faulty, leaky pipes.

Yep that's 1,078,210,000,000 litres of water per year stolen from our rivers.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/RkJP0KAsoX

Same principle for the @WaterUK industry. It pays for the industry to #pollute and collect the odd fine. Take away the morality - not famously big in huge corporations - and it's game on, with @EnvAgency just as demonstrably hopeless in this field. Pollution timebombs. https://t.co/w3JA5AGWZb
Could have added @EnvAgency  got plenty of powers to prevent #water industry #pollution but won't use them and decided to slash the resources just in case anyone tried. https://t.co/4dcCPyVA3q

Great progress has been made to dredge the Steeping River and the Wainfleet relief channel.

https://t.co/0xOqxHqZgB

Work only possible thanks to contributions from partners @LincolnshireCC, @eastlindseyDC, @NFUEastMidlands, @W4IDB, @robertcaudwell  @wendybowkett @wmcidb https://t.co/WkH2ii8qrF
That really is a sad, sad #chalkstream sight. https://t.co/hQY6LpBVGb

Fantastic and very inspirational short video on making sponge cities to reduce flooding and increase groundwater penetration
How about it Leeds? @lisamulherin
@EnvAgency @YorkshireWater @tomriordan @MargoCHanson

https://t.co/WIFGRwg3lA

Eyam Moor, Derbyshire:
‚ñ™Ô∏èBirds left to die in pens.
‚ñ™Ô∏èCarcasses thrown in the bracken. 
‚ñ™Ô∏èReports to Trading Standards & DEFRA ignored. 
Gamekeepers are causing carnage on our moors and the authorities are still failing to act. 
@HighPeakGreens @peakdistrict @WarOnWildlife https://t.co/Ddm6wkWfYd

Yikes. User satisfaction rates for @EnvAgency's Check Your Long Term Flood Risk and Flood Map for Planning services are ‚Ä¶ not good.  https://t.co/SDABwREdcs | https://t.co/cqiImJkoiO + https://t.co/TjdsRoK6mU | #FOI #floodrisk #defradata #govtech #UX

[1/2] https://t.co/zdFiz1o6Vh

tweets.text:
Kitchen roll is one of the top 3 #unflushables people have admitted to flushing down the toilet
 
Unlike toilet paper it doesn't dissolve & instead causes blockages
 
‚ùåNever flush kitchen roll down the loo 
 
üíöProtect your pipes & our #environment 

#Unblocktober @stwater https://t.co/IV3kqi1gL5

So who is going to step forward and take responsibility for the appalling state of the River Nene just to the East of Peterborough city centre? Sunken boats, piles of litter, collapsing banks @PeterboroughCC @EnvAgencyAnglia @PboroughMatters @peterboroughtel @PeterboroughCS
How it started and how‚Äôs it going. Still like a hat, more so to keep my head warm üòä@RoyalNavy @metpoliceuk @SurreyPolice @EnvAgency https://t.co/rVzBIVCqNf

tweets.text: Red diesel and carbon https://t.co/3NNTLiRaQv

So it's intriguing / troubling to learn that the @EnvAgency has to restock our rivers to the tune of over half a million (520,819) fish per annum due to replace stocks lost to pollution or following habitat or water quality improvements. 
https://t.co/g8IuZalD51

Do you often use cotton balls, pads or buds?
 
Never put them down the loo as they cause blockages and harm our environment. 
 
To protect your pipes and the environment, only flush the three Ps - poo, pee and toilet paper. 

#Unblocktober #BinIt4Beaches
@EnvAgencyYNE What about 'flushable toilet wipes'? https://t.co/jdABxHlx4o

@EnvAgencyAnglia @PHE_uk @JamesBevanEA @PHE_London @EnvAgencySE Are you going to be taking air quality samples at #SouthallWaterside and at all the #gasworks that you have issued a permit to? Despite multiple complaints from 2017 why didn't you adopt this methodology in #Southall? #Environmentalinjustice

Fantastic to see the efforts of local residents, @pinder_chauhan, @NorthantsPolice, @NorthamptonBC, @andrealeadsom & various agencies work to get this resolved

The travellers have now left but cleaning up the site will be a major task. I'll be continuing to with NBC & @EnvAgency https://t.co/QMobQBgC0Q

@LimpenhoeGirl @NorfolkWT @N_Rivers_Trust @WNGreens This is what‚Äôs odd about this ridiculous over dredging where it runs alongside the reserve there are no houses üßêjust a load of fields with Horseyüê¥things This is where it starts & is already over dug ‚òπÔ∏è& running clear at this point @The_WMA @EnvAgencyAnglia https://t.co/NL8B70PV8i

We are desperate to support these groups with further monitoring tools so we are seeking funding to do just that.

tweets.text: I'm sharing these slides on #MentalHealthAwareness day as they demonstrate the dreadful effect #flooding has on people's #mentalhealth - find out if you are at risk of flooding and take action using the advice from https://t.co/vm9R4Zna4s  @TheFloodHub @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/EKStTJc85i

urls.title: The Flood Hub
urls.description: Posted: 07/06/21 From 14th ‚Äì 18th May we are hosting a Sustainable Drainage Systems (SuDS) Focus Week, looking at what SuDS are, how they reduce flood risk, and the many benefits they provide. There will be examples of the types of SuDS you can install in your home and garden, and case studies of larger SuDS projects across the North West. Posted: 24/05/21 On 19 May 2021 four new flood warning services were launched in Coniston (Cumbria) Caton (Lancashire), and Worthington and Atherton (Greater Manchester)
